verbose_text: The SUMOylation pathway involves a cascade of enzymes, similar to ubiquitination, with a single E1 activating enzyme (SAE1 / UBA2), a single E2 conjugating enzyme (UBC9), multiple E3 ligating enzymes (Protein Inhibitors of Activated STAT [PIAS], PC2, MMS21, and RanBP2), which provide substrate specificity, and multiple pro teases (SENPs) that both cleave the SUMO moiety from target proteins and process SUMO itself (XREF_FIG).
evidence: E3-ligating enzymes (Protein Inhibitors of Activated STAT
